Name: Coptic textile
Description: A band of textile in linen and wool.The motif consists of a geometric allover pattern of lattice enclosing octagons and 8-point star-cross etc., on a scarlet all wool ground. It is inlaid in natural flax threads carried along the back of the work.Technique: plain weave ground. Pattern inlaid on linen thread, one row of ground between each inlaid thread. Selvedge.Ends per inch (warp threads): 32.Picks per inch (weft threads): 28 over ground.
